contentrichtext.text: [[File:Royal Standard of Mauritius.svg|thumb|300px|Queen's Personal Mauritian Flag]] The '''Queen's Personal Mauritian Flag''', sometimes known as the '''Royal Standard of Mauritius''', was the personal flag of [[Elizabeth II of the United Kingdom|Queen Elizabeth II]] in her role as [[Politics of Mauritius|Queen of Mauritius]] from (1968â€“1992). The flag was only used by the Queen when she was in [[Mauritius]], or attending an event abroad in her role as head of state of Mauritius. The Queen's representative, the [[Governor-General of Mauritius]] had his own flag. The Queen's flag consisted of the [[Coat of arms of Mauritius]] in banner form: quarterly azure and or, in the first quarter a lymphad of the last in the second, 3 palm trees eradicated vert, in the third, a key in pale the wards downwards gules, and in the issuant, from the base a pile, and in chief a mullet argent. A blue disc of the letter "E" crowned surrounded by a garland of gold roses defaces the flag. The disc is taken from the [[Personal Flag of Queen Elizabeth II|Queen's Personal Flag]]. ==See also== * [[Flag of Mauritius]] ==External links== * [http://www.crwflags.com/fotw/flags/mu_1968.html#qe Queen Elizabeth II's Personal Standard in Mauritius] at ''Flags of the World''. Accessed 16 Jan 07. {{Royal Standards of Elizabeth II}} [[Category:Elizabeth II flags|Mauritian]]
